info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 29 at 8:02PM EDT until July 29 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Mecklenburg County in south central Virginia... * Until 900 PM EDT. * At 802 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Dryburg, or 8 miles south of Clover, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Clarksville, Boydton, Buffalo Springs, Nelson, Rogers Corner, Richardson, Buffalo Junction, Finchley, John H Kerr Reservoir, and Skipwith. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
